page.title: 16 SALTWOOD VILLAGE.
page.content: Saltwood Church was built by the Normans at the beginning of the 12th century. It was originally built as a knave with a chancel. The chancel has been extended towards the East, an the knave has had a tower built at the West end of it. The North aisle has been added since. The most popular one of these is the Parish Eucharist. The attendance at the principle service varies a great deal, but it is usually about 120 to 150 people. The church holds about 200. _ As we are in the diocese of Canterbury, the arch-bishop should do the confirmations but as he is very busy the suffragan bishop of Dover does it instead.
